4.6: Then he said to me, “This is what the LORD says to Zerubbabel: It is not by force nor by strength, but by my Spirit, says the LORD of Heaven’s Armies.
4.4: Then I asked the angel, “What are these, my lord? What do they mean?”
4.13: “Don’t you know?” he asked. “No, my lord,” I replied.

13.7: “Awake, O sword, against my shepherd,the man who is my partner,”says the LORD of Heaven’s Armies.“Strike down the shepherd,and the sheep will be scattered,and I will turn against the lambs.
13.9: I will bring that group through the fireand make them pure.I will refine them like silverand purify them like gold.They will call on my name,and I will answer them.I will say, ‘These are my people,’and they will say, ‘The LORD is our God.’”
13.3: If anyone continues to prophesy, his own father and mother will tell him, ‘You must die, for you have prophesied lies in the name of the LORD.’ And as he prophesies, his own father and mother will stab him.
13.2: “And on that day,” says the LORD of Heaven’s Armies, “I will erase idol worship throughout the land, so that even the names of the idols will be forgotten. I will remove from the land both the false prophets and the spirit of impurity that came with them.
13.1: “On that day a fountain will be opened for the dynasty of David and for the people of Jerusalem, a fountain to cleanse them from all their sins and impurity.
13.4: “On that day people will be ashamed to claim the prophetic gift. No one will pretend to be a prophet by wearing prophet’s clothes.
13.6: And if someone asks, ‘Then what about those wounds on your chest? ’ he will say, ‘I was wounded at my friends’ house!’
13.5: He will say, ‘I’m no prophet; I’m a farmer. I began working for a farmer as a boy.’
13.8: Two-thirds of the people in the landwill be cut off and die,” says the LORD.“But one-third will be left in the land.
